opencard.opt.security

Class RSAPrivateKey

  • java.lang.Object
    • opencard.opt.security.RSAPrivateKey
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.security.Key, java.security.PrivateKey

    public class RSAPrivateKey
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.security.PrivateKey
    Contains an RSA private key. Implements interface java.security.PrivateKey. For an alternative class that allows signing via the chinese remainder's algorithm see RSACRTKey. In this package OpenCard provides key classes for common algorithms like RSA, DSA (or DES) that each concrete card service implementing a card service interface should support instead of defining its own key classes. Only for new PKA algorithms that OpenCard does not yet support a card service may define its own key classes.
    Version:
    $Id: RSAPrivateKey.java,v 1.2 1999/10/20 13:15:00 damke Exp $
    Author:
    Michael Baentsch (mib@zurich.ibm.com)
    See Also:
    PrivateKey, RSACRTKey, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • RSAPrivateKey

        public RSAPrivateKey(byte[] m,
             byte[] e,
             int inputLength,
             int outputLength,
             int keyLength)
        Produce an RSAPrivateKey from the given byte arrays.

        Parameters:
        m - Modulus
        e - private exponent
        inputLength - Number of bytes accepted for input to signature routine.
        outputLength - Number of bytes produced by signature routine.
        keyLength - The nominal size of the key in bits.
